intro: Lactuca hallaisanensis, commonly known as the Hallaisan lettuce, is a rare and endemic species native to the Korean Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its delicate, edible leaves that are typically harvested for culinary use. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
